blogs.title: What is a programming language? The most popular programming languages today
blogs.shortcontent: “What is a programming language, why use a programming language to communicate with a computer?” This is the most frequently asked question by newcomers to IT. Follow the article to learn more!
blogs.longcontent:
A programming language is a computer language, used in programming to implement algorithms, consisting of a set of strings that produce various types of machine code output. A programming language is often described as divided into two parts: syntax (formal) and semantics (meaning). Programmers will use programming languages to develop programs, software, scripts, and instructions for the computer to execute and follow. Although each language has its own syntax, many programming languages still have similarities with each other.
Some of the most popular programming languages
If you are wondering to choose the right programming language for you, you can refer to some of the most popular programming languages below!

1. JavaScript
It's no surprise that JavaScript tops this list. The popularity of this language comes from two main reasons: most web browsers use JavaScript and it is also one of the easiest languages to learn with a lot of flexible syntax. Although it is a language for the Front-end, JavaScript is still used for the Backend through Node.js.

Moreover, JavaScript has countless communities, online courses that support users, making it even more accessible and applicable.
Applications of JavaScript: Web Development Developing Game Mobile apps Building web servers

2. Java
Java is currently one of the most sought-after languages by employers globally (#3 according to HackerRank) and has held the #5 spot on Stack Overflow's list of most commonly used languages. for 2 consecutive years.

Java's popularity is mainly due to the fact that the language is relatively easy to learn and use; has incredible security and can handle large amounts of data. These features make Java the ideal language in the financial sector and are applied in e-banking, online payment and stock market.

Applications of Java: E-Commerce Finance Application Development

3. Python
Python is a user-friendly back-end language that is even considered similar to English. Python is also famous for its rigor, fast, powerful and available in all operating systems.

Several popular digital tools and platforms have been developed in Python, including YouTube, Google Search, and iRobot.

Applications of Python: Back end development Data science Application development

4. Java
Java is currently one of the most sought-after languages by employers globally (#3 according to HackerRank) and has held the #5 spot on Stack Overflow's list of most commonly used languages. for 2 consecutive years.

Applications of Java: E-Commerce Finance Application Development

5. C++
C++ is one of the most powerful programming languages and is used in many industries, including VR, software and game development, robotics, and scientific computing. C++ is an extension of C that works well for programming systems that run applications, as opposed to the applications themselves. C++ also works well for multi-device and cross-platform systems. Over time, programmers wrote a large set of libraries and compilers for C++.

Conclude
Above is the concept of programming languages and some popular programming languages. Hope this article will be useful to you ^^

blogs.title: What is web programming? What skills do web developers need?
blogs.shortcontent: Walking around the communities, we all see people saying that "web developers are hot and not afraid of unemployment", so what is web programming and what skills do web developers need? Check out this article!
blogs.longcontent:
1. What is web programming? Correct understanding of the hot industry
The concept of web programming
Although you have heard about web programming a lot, many of you must still wonder what web programming is and whether web programming is the same as web design.

In essence, web programming is getting all the data from the web design department and turning it into a web engine that interacts with the database and can interact with users through the language of the machine. count. After building the website, it will need some tools to help website administrators to measure and control the amount of traffic pouring into the website, uptime, downtime, visitor exit rate, bandwidth overload, etc. ...
The concept of web programming

Currently, website programmers are divided into 3 main positions, including: Front-end programmer, Back-end programmer and Full-stack developer. Front-end developers will be in charge of completing the parts that users can see and interact with on the website, and back-end developers will be responsible for all the parts that make the website available. can run as smoothly as server programming, controlling how web pages load and run. Finally, Full-stack programmers, these people, in addition to Front-end and Back-end jobs, will also have to be fluent in other jobs such as providing solutions, building systems,... to Ensure that you can proactively complete a project from start to finish.

Is this a job "thirst" for personnel?
Yes, it can be affirmed that web programming is a profession that requires a lot of manpower, but what are the characteristics of web programming that requires so much manpower and is so hot?

In fact, almost every business needs to have its own website, not only for branding and marketing, but also for selling directly on the website because the buyer's behavior has changed. from offline to online. Therefore, the workload is also gradually increasing with the number of websites launched.
However, besides the quantity, the quality of websites is also required higher, so employers will require more qualified programmers. This also means that if you don't have to be "thirsty" for personnel, you will not be afraid of lack of work, because businesses will always require good people and higher and higher requirements, not employees who are in the right industry but not in the right industry. handle the job.
2. Skills required to become a Website Developer
With the above information, we have understood what web programming is and the potential for growth in this position. But what skills do you need to become a web developer?

Advanced skill
Not only for programming but in any profession, professional knowledge and skills are also extremely necessary, because it determines your capacity and position in the industry. Find yourself a path that is right for you and stick with that choice. Like a child, before we learn to run, we need to know how to walk. So you can pick out a suitable language and start learning from there.

It is important to always be consistent, dig deep and study a language well first, because once you are good at one language, you will have more skills to learn more languages.

A programmer will need to practice logical thinking, always put himself in the user's mind, and hone his search and research skills when facing a problem that needs to be solved because programming in particular and IT in general will always always changing, need to be constantly updated.
Soft skills
Besides the above technical skills, soft skills are also an important factor determining whether a programmer is successful or not. People with high EQ will have a higher success rate, because in addition to being professional, they also know how to make things go more smoothly. Here are some soft skills that programmers should have:

Communication skills
Problem solving skills
Teamwork skill
Negotiation and negotiation skills
Research and analysis skills...
3. Conclusion
Hopefully the above information has helped people better understand the concept of web programming and the potential of the web programming profession in the future. Hope you learn well!

blogs.title: Is it difficult to learn programming by yourself? 5 tips for better self-study
blogs.shortcontent: Programming is gradually becoming a "hot" industry and a trend of many young people today. Is it difficult to learn programming by yourself? This article will share with you 5 tips to learn programming better by yourself!
blogs.longcontent:
1. Is it difficult to learn programming by yourself? What are the advantages and disadvantages of self-study?
Any profession will require self-study and self-research skills in learners, and IT requires it even more, because technology will always change and be updated continuously. However, there are still quite a few of you who wonder about self-learning programming because you don't really understand it properly.
Misunderstandings about self-taught programming
Self-taught programming is completely self-taught? Self-study programming will have to tinker with, find the right path for you? Does self-study mean you'll be alone on your own? The answer is no, those are just misunderstandings of many people. Self-learning programming means that you will not become a student of universities, do not register to join external centers, but will research and research the IT industry yourself. However, self-discovering does not mean that you will have to "groping" alone, because at the present time, there are many free sources for you to consult knowledge such as Google, Youtube, Tiktok or even GPT Chat. ,... On Youtube and the Website, there are also many courses that are completely free and of high quality, which can help you learn more methodically and easily like F8 Official or F8's website. In addition to knowledge, another thing that also confuses many of you when you first learn is orientation. “How should I go?; which language should I learn so as not to be outdated?; Should we follow direction A, abandon direction B?;....” However, current programming channels are not only specialized but will also help us choose the most suitable direction for us, they also There will be more communities for you to exchange, ask questions and share your stories.

Pros and cons of self-taught programming
To answer the question "is it difficult to learn programming by yourself?" then maybe we should find out what are the pros and cons of this learning method!

Advantage:

Self-study will help you practice thinking and self-study skills, self-study, self-study and find a way to solve a problem.
Save money, time, can work while learning because of the full initiative.
Practice logical thinking.
Have more self-management skills, know how to plan and allocate time appropriately.
Defect:

It is easy to give up if you are not persistent and patient.
If you can't find the right direction or learn the wrong method, it will be easy to lose direction.
Takes more time.
It is more difficult to study at school or center because you have to make your own route.
So with the above advantages and disadvantages, surely each of you will come up with the answer to the question "is it difficult to learn programming by yourself" for yourself, right?

2. 5 tips for better self-learning
Tip 1: Definitely find the right direction for yourself
The direction is extremely important, so before you start, remember to figure out what you like, what you will pursue and stick with it. To find direction, in addition to hobbies and passions, your own abilities are also extremely important, so don't ignore it!

Tip 2: Always remember that programming is not an easy job
This is probably a self-talk that we should keep in mind, because information technology in general and programming in particular is a difficult industry, requiring a lot of effort, not easy and "natural" have a salary of thousands of dollars as many people say. Remember this, you will be more confident.

Tip 3: Persevere, don't give up
As mentioned above, programming is not easy, so don't give up. You will have to go through many trials before reaching the sweet fruit and success is not for the impatient and impatient.

Tip 4: Always be ready for any situation
Being a programmer means that you will have to be mentally prepared for every situation, because technology is always changing. You can sit for a long time, put a lot of effort into coding a program, but when it's almost done, you have to give it all up and replace it with a faster, more accurate solution. You need to understand that programming changes very quickly and that there are many good ways to approach problems. Finding new solutions is the reason of programming.

Tip 5: Dare to start
Last but most importantly, have the courage to start. The first step is always the hardest, but if we dare to take it, we will open a long and hopeful journey before us.

Conclude
Hopefully with this article, you have given yourself a separate answer to the question "is it difficult to learn programming by yourself" and have been able to make a decision about the appropriate learning method. See you in the next posts!

blogs.title: There is also "Typescript" in Javascript that we don't know for a long time
blogs.shortcontent: Maybe the title will confuse some of you, new or known about Typescript (TS), let's start the article to answer any questions:
blogs.longcontent:
How to write "TS" in JS
First we will learn the PropTypes keyword in ReactJS

1. What are PropTypes:
The concept of Prop in React, you probably already know (if you don't know, please open Mr. Son's video immediately).

When we pass Prop from the parent Component (Com) to the child (Com), each Prop has a different type, right.

We want each Prop to have its own type, to avoid the case that the Prop is a function and you pass the object, it will be "Does this man's beard hold the other woman" =))

2. How to install:
npm install --save prop-types

3. Usage:
In the above code we can see that in the line Counter.propTypes = ... we have declared the data type for it

Ex: What if we pass the wrong data type? (Instead of passing count as number, I will pass string)

Boom, something went wrong here
Disadvantages compared to TS
There is a disadvantage of this guy PropTypes compared to TS is that it will not report an error directly when you code the wrong type like in TS, it only indicates an error on your log.

In short
Through this article, I hope it will be useful for you.
